thread.section_title: Reuters: Financial Services and Real Estate
thread.title: TREASURIES-U.S. yield curve flattens to decade low as Chicago PMI falls

title: TREASURIES-U.S. yield curve flattens to decade low as Chicago PMI falls
text:
March 29, 2018 / 2:12 PM / Updated 13 minutes ago TREASURIES-U.S. yield curve flattens to decade low as Chicago PMI falls Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
NEW YORK, March 29 (Reuters) - The spread between U.S. short- and long-dated Treasuries shrank on Thursday to its tightest level in a decade as a private-sector gauge on Chicago-area factory activity unexpectedly fell to a one-year low in March. 
At 10:04 a.m. (1404 GMT), the yield gap between two-year and 10-year Treasuries hit 47.1 basis points, which was the tightest since September 2007. It was last at 47.3 basis points, according to Tradeweb data. (Reporting by Richard Leong Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)
